Service.name: Marsviewer
Service.abstract_desc: The Mars Image Viewer (Marsviewer) is an image viewing tool tailored to Mars in-situ missions.
Service.system_requirements_note: Installers for Mac OS X, Windows, and Linux. Should be installable on any platform that supports Java 6+.
Service.description: The Mars Image Viewer (Marsviewer) is an image viewing tool tailored to Mars in-situ missions. It makes it easy to view original images (EDRs) as well as all derived image products (RDRs), such as XYZ maps, slope, reachability, mosaics, etc. Originally designed as a quality control tool for the MER image processing team, it sees wide use throughout the MER, MSL, and PHX ops and science teams (with InSight and Mars 2020 coming soon). Leveraging webification (w10n) on the backend, Marsviewer has now been extended to work with the PDS Imaging archive data.
